meanings.definition: Characterized by an abnormal and unhealthy interest in disturbing and unpleasant subjects, especially death and disease.
meanings.sent1: She had a morbid fascination with horror movies.
meanings.sent2: The morbid movie left me feeling uneasy.
meanings.sent3: His morbid sense of humor always involved spooky jokes.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned house had a morbid atmosphere, like a ghost town.
meanings.sent5: The morbid story lingered in her mind long after she read it.

meanings.definition: Of the nature of or indicative of disease.
meanings.sent1: The doctor noticed a morbid growth on the patient's skin.
meanings.sent2: The morbid symptoms suggested a serious illness.
meanings.sent3: The morbid-looking plant turned out to be a rare species.
meanings.sent4: The morbid decay of the old building was a sign of neglect.
meanings.sent5: The morbid odor in the room made everyone feel queasy.

meanings.sent1: The crime scene was morbid, with bloodstains everywhere.
meanings.sent2: The morbid details of the story made her shiver.
meanings.sent3: The morbid scene in the horror movie was surprisingly realistic.
meanings.sent4: The morbid sight of the injured animal tugged at her heartstrings.
meanings.sent5: The morbid painting depicted a haunting scene of despair.
